## `no did mount set state`

### `0`

```

 unknown:4:12 lint/react/noDidMountSetState ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

  ✖ Avoid this.setState in componentDidMount. This can cause an unexpected second render, which can
    cause visual layout thrashing.

    2 │         class Hello extends React.Component {
    3 │           componentDidMount() {
  > 4 │             this.setState({
      │             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    5 │               name: 'John'
    6 │             });

━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━

✖ Found 1 problem

```

### `0: formatted`

```
class Hello extends React.Component {
	componentDidMount() {
		this.setState({
			name: "John",
		});
	}
}

```

### `1: formatted`

```
class Hello extends React.Component {
	componentDidMount() {
		foo();
		this.setState({
			name: "John",
		});
	}
}
```

### `4: formatted`

```
class Hello extends React.Component {
	componentDidMount() {
		if (condition) {
			this.setState({
				name: "John",
			});
		}
	}
}

```
